required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brain Activity During Birth for Prediction of Newborns at Risk for Brain Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Brain Activity During Birth for Prediction of Newborns at Risk for Brain Injury

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is early identification of asphyxiated newborns through eeg starting in the delivery room.

detailed_description.textblock:
There is a need for a reliable detector of birth asphyxia so that newborns with birth asphyxia can have timely and accurate diagnosis to receive therapeutic hypothermia within 6 hrs of life, which has been shown to significantly reduce deaths and improve long term developmental outcomes.
This study is designed to record EEG during birth transition through the first 10 minutes of life.

primary_outcome.description: May be up to 60 minutes if applicable

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin irritation from EES or hydrogel electrodes
Successful adhesion of EES to skin

other_outcome.description: At 1, 5, 10, 15 and 20 minutes of life if done
for meconium suctioning or ventilation purposes
By bag and mask or endotracheal tube

other_outcome.time_frame: Birth to 10 minutes of life. May extend to 60 minutes of life if applicable.

study_pop.textblock: Term infants at delivery (37-44 weeks gestational age)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Term infants
- Signed Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known congenital anomalies

overall_official.affiliation: Sharp Mary Birch Hospital for Women and Newborns

facility.name: Sharp Mary Birch Hospital for Women and Newborns

link.description: cdc: Complications during pregnancy & birth are among leading causes of infant mortality
